cobblemon.species.ehgobulbasaur.name: Bulbasaur
cobblemon.species.ehgobulbasaur.desc1: The plants that grow on Bulbasaur use its body for nutrients. Bulbasaur relies on the plant for protection.
cobblemon.species.ehgoivysaur.name: Ivysaur
cobblemon.species.ehgoivysaur.desc1: As the body of Ivysaur dries up, it grows a patch of dense vines that aid it in battle.
cobblemon.species.ehgovenusaur.name: Venusaur
cobblemon.species.ehgovenusaur.desc1: Large, thorn covered brambles protect an aged cactus. Small rodent Pokémon tend to make nests in the dry grass patches at the base of the cactus.
cobblemon.species.ehgocharmander.name: Charmander
cobblemon.species.ehgocharmander.desc1: A small dragon Pokémon that enjoys a competitive bout. As it battles, the flame on its tail gets hotter.
cobblemon.species.ehgocharmeleon.name: Charmeleon
cobblemon.species.ehgocharmeleon.desc1: Without pity, its sharp claws destroy foes. If it encounters a strong enemy, it becomes agitated, and the flame on its tail flares with a bluish white color.
cobblemon.species.ehgocharizard.name: Charizard
cobblemon.species.ehgocharizard.desc1: A powerful dragon Pokémon that is said to be hard to tame. It likes to soar high above the clouds.
cobblemon.species.ehgosquirtle.name: Squirtle
cobblemon.species.ehgosquirtle.desc1: Squirtle produces a small cloud as a tail that it then uses to float on top of and keep itself cool. They can often be found snoozing, sprawled out on their own cloud.
cobblemon.species.ehgowartortle.name: Wartortle
cobblemon.species.ehgowartortle.desc1: Wartortle's body starts to develop even more cloud forms, allowing it to temporarily hover sometimes. It uses the cloud as a cloak during foggy days.
cobblemon.species.ehgoblastoise.name: Blastoise
cobblemon.species.ehgoblastoise.desc1: Blastoise drift around high in the sky, forming ice crystals on their shell that they use in battle once they've landed.
cobblemon.species.ehgospearow.name: Spearow
cobblemon.species.ehgospearow.desc1: These Spearow became an invasive species because it had no natural predators. In order to stay at the top of the food chain, it adapted into a vicious predator.
cobblemon.species.ehgofearow.name: Fearow
cobblemon.species.ehgofearow.desc1: Because its wings are too thin to fly effectively, it instead uses them as weapons, fanning them out to sweep opponents in all directions.
cobblemon.species.ehgooddish.name: Oddish
cobblemon.species.ehgooddish.desc1: As Oddish's habitat changed, it failed to adapt quick enough, which caused its leafs to wilt. Nowadays, these Oddish can be seen in dark caves and forests.
cobblemon.species.ehgogloom.name: Gloom
cobblemon.species.ehgogloom.desc1: Despite their abiotic features, when exposed to enough light, Oddish may evolve into Gloom. Gloom use decorative skulls to scare away other Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.ehgomagnemite.name: Magnemite
cobblemon.species.ehgomagnemite.desc1: Once Hazeport City plateaued in urbanization, many Magnemite migrated to Genisis Forest. Over the years, they became one with the plant life.
cobblemon.species.ehgomagneton.name: Magneton
cobblemon.species.ehgomagneton.desc1: Instead of attaching to each other like standard Magnemite, these Magneton are grown from their original Magnemite form.
cobblemon.species.ehgogrimer.name: Grimer
cobblemon.species.ehgogrimer.desc1: This version of Grimer is made up of hot asphalt. Often used in cities to help fill potholes, this Pokémon's body reaches temperatures of just over 300 degrees.
cobblemon.species.ehgomuk.name: Muk
cobblemon.species.ehgomuk.desc1: As Muk traverses urban areas, various debris and items get stuck in it. The differing street signs that end up in Muk help set it apart from one another.
cobblemon.species.ehgoshellder.name: Shellder
cobblemon.species.ehgoshellder.desc1: This Shellder can often times be found attached to a Slowbro. When removed and left alone, it will hunt down other sea creatures to feed on.
cobblemon.species.ehgochansey.name: Chansey
cobblemon.species.ehgochansey.desc1: Chansey is so obsessed with protecting eggs that it will even defend the nests of other Pokémon species. It uses its rock as a decoy egg to trick other predators.
cobblemon.species.ehgotangela.name: Tangela
cobblemon.species.ehgotangela.desc1: After its habitat was destroyed to make way for a large city, Tangela was forced to adapt by using left over wire from the maintenance tunnels for its new body.
cobblemon.species.pikachuxfemale.name: Pikachu
cobblemon.species.pikachuxfemale.desc1: It is a real anomaly between X Pokémon. Its nature makes it friendly even to human.
cobblemon.species.pikachuxmale.name: Pikachu
cobblemon.species.pikachuxmale.desc1: It is a real anomaly between X Pokémon. Its nature makes it friendly even to human.
cobblemon.species.raichux.name: Raichu
cobblemon.species.raichux.desc1: Gym Leader Surge's faithful companion, it has been brought back to life after a terrible accident. It is as fast as fragile.
cobblemon.species.eldiwanmeowth.name: Meowth
cobblemon.species.eldiwanmeowth.desc1: Due to its delicate fur and its psychic powers, even veteran Trainers find it difficult to raise this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.ponytax.name: Ponyta
cobblemon.species.ponytax.desc1: A thick cloud mane makes it float in the air. It is still a green baby, so it can only clumsily fly around.
cobblemon.species.rapidashx.name: Rapidash
cobblemon.species.rapidashx.desc1: A peaceful tempered X Pokémon. However, if it gets furious, it wraps itself in thunderclouds and triggers raging lightning storms.
cobblemon.species.storm_rapidashx.name: RapidashX
cobblemon.species.storm_rapidashx.desc1: A peaceful tempered X Pokémon. However, if it gets furious, it wraps itself in thunderclouds and triggers raging lightning storms.
cobblemon.species.gastlyx.name: Gastly
cobblemon.species.gastlyx.desc1: Compressed by an enormous pressure, it body is protected by a shell as hard as steel. Nobody knows how it looks inside this shell.
cobblemon.species.haunterx.name: Haunter
cobblemon.species.haunterx.desc1: It catches even the most elusive preys with its claws. It tortures them and once it's had enough, it lets them go.
cobblemon.species.gengarx.name: Gengar
cobblemon.species.gengarx.desc1: Because its intelligence is exceptional, Gengar can communicate with any form of life. However, it uses this gift for not-so-ethical purposes.
cobblemon.species.electabuzzx.name: Electabuzz
cobblemon.species.electabuzzx.desc1: Bumping its fists together, it creates strong explosions. It will discharge its fury around when enraged.
cobblemon.species.dittox.name: Ditto
cobblemon.species.dittox.desc1: Following a great number of experiments, it became extremely unstable, but it developed the ability to Transform even without seeing its target.
cobblemon.species.mewtwox.name: Mewtwo
cobblemon.species.mewtwox.desc1: It has been further genetically modified by Team Dimension. Its psychic powers are frightening.
cobblemon.species.ehgochikorita.name: Chikorita
cobblemon.species.ehgochikorita.desc1: Chikorita's thick, spiky exterior protects it from most predators. The tips of the spikes are coated in a sweet and sticky substance that humans love, but repulses most Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.ehgobayleef.name: Bayleef
cobblemon.species.ehgobayleef.desc1: The red part of Bayleef is leathery hard, where the white bottom half of Bayleef is quite soft. Being vulnerable here requires Bayleef to be constantly vigilant of its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.ehgomeganium.name: Meganium
cobblemon.species.ehgomeganium.desc1: The black dots scattered around the white portion of Meganium are seeds. They get scattered around when it battles, eventually leading to the growth of fruit-bearing trees.
cobblemon.species.ehgocyndaquil.name: Cyndaquil
cobblemon.species.ehgocyndaquil.desc1: Cyndaquil is always producing a small cloud of volcanic ash, which is electrically charged. It can be tough to handle for new trainers.
cobblemon.species.ehgoquilava.name: Quilava
cobblemon.species.ehgoquilava.desc1: As Quilava gets stronger, it is able to better control its volcanic ash cloud. It has learned to store and use the electricity generated by the cloud.
cobblemon.species.ehgotyphlosion.name: Typhlosion
cobblemon.species.ehgotyphlosion.desc1: Typhlosion is very dangerous to be around if it is not in a good mood. The energy that is generated from the heat and electricity matches that of a nuclear reactor.
cobblemon.species.ehgototodile.name: Totodile
cobblemon.species.ehgototodile.desc1: The saliva in Totodile's mouth is corrosive to most materials. That, combined with its strong jaw, allows it to eat almost anything it gets its mouth on.
cobblemon.species.ehgocroconaw.name: Croconaw
cobblemon.species.ehgocroconaw.desc1: Croconaw's hunched stance appears to be an adaptation to aid it in traversing cramped sewer tunnels. Rattata and Grimer are not safe in the territory of this species.
cobblemon.species.ehgoferaligatr.name: Feraligatr
cobblemon.species.ehgoferaligatr.desc1: This form of Feraligatr thrives in the dark murky waters of swamps and sewers. These Pokémon can cause problems in sewers because their strong jaws can rip through pipes with ease.
cobblemon.species.ehgohoothoot.name: Hoothoot
cobblemon.species.ehgohoothoot.desc1: The crescent on its head glows brightest when the moon is full. It can confuse prey by convincing them that the moon is coming right at them when it's really just bird.
cobblemon.species.ehgonoctowl.name: EhgoNoctowl
cobblemon.species.ehgonoctowl.desc1: Noctowl use the crest on its head to reflect light into the eyes of its prey. On moonless nights, one may mistake the crest as the actual moon.
cobblemon.species.ehgomarill.name: Marill
cobblemon.species.ehgomarill.desc1: It uses its tail to swing around the rock end with ease. When not in combat, it uses the rock as a perch to see above tall grass and watch for enemies.
cobblemon.species.ehgoazumarill.name: Marill
cobblemon.species.ehgoazumarill.desc1: In battle, Azumarill uses its tail as a flail or war hammer, swinging and smashing it into opponents. Outside of battle, it swings its tail fancily to attract a worthy partner.
cobblemon.species.ehgoblissey.name: Blissey
cobblemon.species.ehgoblissey.desc1: Because of the strong bond with their trainer, Blissey will do anything in its power to keep the trainer safe. Blissey are often considered too overbearing.
cobblemon.species.unownearth.name: Unown
cobblemon.species.unownearth.desc1: Their appearance resembles the symbol in Dragalisk's mouth, which is why the Cardinals have considered them profane since time immemorial.
cobblemon.species.unownxenoverse.name: Unown
cobblemon.species.unownxenoverse.desc1: For centuries they have been considered sacred as their appearance resembles the symbol on the Luxflon's gem.
cobblemon.species.smearglex.name: Smeargle
cobblemon.species.smearglex.desc1: It produces a delicious low-calory cream, but it becomes rancid if not kept cool.
cobblemon.species.elekidx.name: Elekid
cobblemon.species.elekidx.desc1: The sparks it scatters from its head can easily cause fires or explosions. It is a real ticking bomb!
cobblemon.species.tyranitarx.name: Tyranitar
cobblemon.species.tyranitarx.desc1: The Tyranitar owned by Dimension General Victor. It generates a defeaning buzz by vibrating its wings.
cobblemon.species.ehgolotad.name: Lotad
cobblemon.species.ehgolotad.desc1: Lotad were used to carry ingredients for chefs many years ago, eventually adapting to serve other purposes in the kitchen. Lotad is a naturally occurring stove top.
cobblemon.species.ehgolombre.name: Lombre
cobblemon.species.ehgolombre.desc1: The flat surface on top of its head sits at a constant 350 degrees Fahrenheit, making it perfect for frying almost any dish a chef could dream up.
cobblemon.species.ehgoludicolo.name: Ludicolo
cobblemon.species.ehgoludicolo.desc1: Anything cooked atop its head gains a unique flavor, which is different for each individual Ludicolo. Some restaurants main attraction is a specific Ludicolo flavoring.
cobblemon.species.ehgoazurill.name: Azurill
cobblemon.species.ehgoazurill.desc1: At birth, the tip of Azurill's tail holds a pebble no larger than a grain of sand. Over time, the pebble grows into a rock too large for Azurill to carry, forcing it to evolve.
cobblemon.species.ehgoswablu.name: Swablu
cobblemon.species.ehgoswablu.desc1: Swablu tuck themselves into the cottony feathers they have to keep warm during blizzards. Flocks hum in unison as they're bundled up.
cobblemon.species.ehgoaltaria.name: Altaria
cobblemon.species.ehgoaltaria.desc1: Altaria's body is so cold that it sometimes freezes the moisture in the air around it into crystals. If you hear an Altaria's song, you can be sure a hail storm is coming.
cobblemon.species.roseliax.name: Roselia
cobblemon.species.roseliax.desc1: Using the auricular organs on its arms, Roselia amplifies the range of its voice. It can even break rocks at full volume.
cobblemon.species.carvanhax.name: Carvanha
cobblemon.species.carvanhax.desc1: It perpetually floats upside down on the surface of the water. Apparently, it doesn't feed on anything to survive.
cobblemon.species.sharpedox.name: Sharpedo
cobblemon.species.sharpedox.desc1: This Pokemon may have appeared long time ago, since very ancient sailors' tales already told of a creature used to devour ships to make them its den.
cobblemon.species.cacneax.name: Cacnea
cobblemon.species.cacneax.desc1: Because its appearance resembles a severed head, everyone who fights this Cacnea is scared to death.
cobblemon.species.cacturnex.name: Cacturne
cobblemon.species.cacturnex.desc1: Its internal body is made of a straw-like material. It shoots its needles to cast cursed spell against enemies.
cobblemon.species.ehgohappiny.name: Happiny
cobblemon.species.ehgohappiny.desc1: In order to adapt to an environment of egg-stealing predators, Happiny has become hyper-aggressive and territorial. It carries an egg-shaped rock in its pouch.
cobblemon.species.ehgomagnezone.name: Magnezone
cobblemon.species.ehgomagnezone.desc1: This Magnezone is a result of a sudden mutation causing one of the Magneton's bodies to absorb the other two and grow rapidly in power.
cobblemon.species.ehgotangrowth.name: Tangrowth
cobblemon.species.ehgotangrowth.desc1: Tangrowth has the ability to absorb and supply electricity through the prongs on the ends of its arms, enabling it to act as a sort of living battery.
cobblemon.species.budewx.name: Budew
cobblemon.species.budewx.desc1: If you put your ear to its sound organ, you will hear the sound of a soft breathing. When it's fired up, the sound becomes deafening.
cobblemon.species.roseradex.name: Roserade
cobblemon.species.roseradex.desc1: It waves its stings to modify any sound wave at will. If it interferes with its opponent's heartbeat, it will cause them irreparable harm.
cobblemon.species.spiritombx.name: Spiritomb
cobblemon.species.spiritombx.desc1: Some theories assert that this is Spiritomb's real appearence--it's the one we already know who comes from the Xenoverse.
cobblemon.species.ehgotrubbish.name: Trubbish
cobblemon.species.ehgotrubbish.desc1: As a result of urban clean-up initiatives, many Trubbish were mistakenly thrown into garbage cans. Being too weak to escape, they instead repurpose the cans as armor.
cobblemon.species.ehgogarbodor.name: Garbodor
cobblemon.species.ehgogarbodor.desc1: When Trubbish eat enough to get too big for their can, they will evolve into a Garbodor. They get larger with the more waste they stuff in their dumpster.
cobblemon.species.yamaskx.name: Yamask
cobblemon.species.yamaskx.desc1: Its calcareous shell resembles an ancient water jar. It is unknown if men's artifacts were inspired by this Pokémon or vice versa.
cobblemon.species.cofagrigusx.name: Cofagrigus
cobblemon.species.cofagrigusx.desc1: Its limbs are made of pure cristalline water. Some people believe that a single sip of that water will give you everlasting life.
cobblemon.species.joltikx.name: Joltik
cobblemon.species.joltikx.desc1: They sneak up falling from the sky in large groups, so they can overcome their small size. Then they bring the prey to Galvantula.
cobblemon.species.galvantulax.name: Gavantula
cobblemon.species.galvantulax.desc1: It freezes the air around its nest. Then it traps prey in a thick ice web, slowly leading them to hypothermia.
cobblemon.species.bisharpx.name: Bisharp
cobblemon.species.bisharpx.desc1: The Bisharp owned by Dimension Sergeant S. The consciences of both A & B's Bisharp coexist in this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.greninjax.name: Greninja
cobblemon.species.greninjax.desc1: It moves under cover of darkness. It throws knives of hell fire at its opponents, piercing their flesh and leaving them with atrocious burns.
cobblemon.species.aegislashx.name: Aegislash
cobblemon.species.aegislashx.desc1: It's mentioned in legends as the companion of the First King. It uses its momentum to move at high speeds.
cobblemon.species.swirlixx.name: Swirlix
cobblemon.species.swirlixx.desc1: The appealing sweet fragrance it releases vaguely resembles that of Leppa Berries. Behind its delicious appearence lies an acid filling.
cobblemon.species.slurpuffx.name: Slurpuff
cobblemon.species.slurpuffx.desc1: Anyone who digests its sweets will feel a strong sense of nausea. The more you eat them, the bigger Slurpuff gets.
cobblemon.species.mareaniex.name: Mareanie
cobblemon.species.mareaniex.desc1: When frightened, it shoots fire and sparks from the top of its head. It appears to be pretty friendly with others of the same specie.
cobblemon.species.toxapexx.name: Toxapex
cobblemon.species.toxapexx.desc1: The special toxin it secretes, when heated, shines brightly. It lures preys and traps tem, using its body as a cage.
cobblemon.species.pyukumukux.name: Pyukumuku
cobblemon.species.pyukumukux.desc1: It is way bigger than the actual Pyukumuku. Expelling its internal organs, it propels itself to strike its opponent.
cobblemon.species.tapukokox.name: Tapu Koko
cobblemon.species.tapukokox.desc1: One of the four beast from Xenoverse, Dragalisk's elite soldiers. It is held by the Cardinal Peyote.
cobblemon.species.tapulelex.name: Tapu Lele
cobblemon.species.tapulelex.desc1: One of the four beast from Xenoverse, Dragalisk's elite soldiers. It is held by the Cardinal Niva.
cobblemon.species.tapubulux.name: Tapu Bulu
cobblemon.species.tapubulux.desc1: One of the four beast from Xenoverse, Dragalisk's elite soldiers. It is held by the Cardinal Abraham.
cobblemon.species.tapufinix.name: Tapu Fini
cobblemon.species.tapufinix.desc1: One of the four beast from Xenoverse, Dragalisk's elite soldiers. It is held by the Cardinal Chua.
cobblemon.species.foliat.name: Foliat
cobblemon.species.foliat.desc1: Although Foliat is unable to fly, it still has an extremely high metabolism. It's often found feeding on sugar-rich nectar and sap found in plants.
cobblemon.species.florabri.name: Florabri
cobblemon.species.florabri.desc1: This energetic Pokémon zips around at speeds that make it nearly invisible to the naked eye. It is playful and competitive by nature.
cobblemon.species.floressum.name: Floressum
cobblemon.species.floressum.desc1: Floressum can synthesize energy with its symbiotic flower. By rapidly flapping its wings, it can create gusts of wind comparable to a tropical storm.
cobblemon.species.kidling.name: Kidling
cobblemon.species.kidling.desc1: Kidling headbutts humans and Pokémon as a sign of affection. When its head makes contact, even gently, the flame on its tail flares up briefly.
cobblemon.species.pyroat.name: Pyroat
cobblemon.species.pyroat.desc1: Pyroat’s flaming hide can be seen streaking across mountainsides at night. When it collides with other Pyroat, the light and noise can be mistaken for an explosion.
cobblemon.species.flairees.name: Flairees
cobblemon.species.flairees.desc1: The fire on Flairees' body propels it with enough force to break steel. It forms its territory by smashing apart and leveling mountaintops.
cobblemon.species.aguade.name: Aguade
cobblemon.species.aguade.desc1: Aguade's face and hands are armored with rock-hard salt. It uses its fists like hammers to break open nuts and its head to block incoming attacks.
cobblemon.species.iguadium.name: Iguadium
cobblemon.species.iguadium.desc1: Aguade's face and hands are armored with rock-hard salt. It uses its fists like hammers to break open nuts and its head to block incoming attacks.
cobblemon.species.aguanaut.name: Aguanaut
cobblemon.species.aguanaut.desc1: Aguanaut devastates its foes with savage blows from its fists and tail, as well as crushing grapples. Its body is armored with dense, impenetrable layers of salt.
cobblemon.species.harpee.name: Harpee
cobblemon.species.harpee.desc1: Harpee's perseverance is unmatched. It purposely builds its nest in places with harsh weather and tough opponents, challenging itself to become stronger.
cobblemon.species.aquilor.name: Aquilor
cobblemon.species.aquilor.desc1: Aquilor lives in treetops and watches its prey before swooping on it. Its sharp eyes can spot the faintest of movements, even through dense foliage.
cobblemon.species.warquila.name: Warquila
cobblemon.species.warquila.desc1: Warquila is a fierce predator that uses its speed and maneuverability to outwit prey. Its powerful talons can tear through even the toughest hides.
cobblemon.species.capig.name: Capig
cobblemon.species.capig.desc1: The pattern on Capig's fur is popularly mimicked by the woven hats of locals. It will sometimes sit on its trainer's head to keep them warm.
cobblemon.species.capabara.name: Capabara
cobblemon.species.capabara.desc1: The thick fur on its arms and head keeps it warm as it tunnels through cold snow. Capabara are often found in groups, huddling together for warmth.
cobblemon.species.cubzero.name: Cubzero
cobblemon.species.cubzero.desc1: The saliva in Cubzero’s mouth freezes at an early age, forming sharp, icy fangs that will never melt. If shattered, new ones will freeze in mere hours.
cobblemon.species.avalynx.name: Avalynx
cobblemon.species.avalynx.desc1: Avalynx excels at stalking its prey in heavy snowstorms. It can move through deep snow and ice effortlessly without making a sound.
cobblemon.species.fawning.name: Fawning
cobblemon.species.fawning.desc1: When first born, Fawning is too weak to defend itself from predators, so it tends to stay near thorny bushes for protection until it joins the herd.
cobblemon.species.llamarsh.name: Llamarsh
cobblemon.species.llamarsh.desc1: The wool around Llamarsh's neck keeps it warm, even in sub-zero temperatures. People in cold climates have used it as clothing for generations.
cobblemon.species.buckston.name: Buckston
cobblemon.species.buckston.desc1: Proud of their power, Buckston constantly battle to test their strength. It is rumored that their migration herds can be seen from space.
cobblemon.species.pengliff.name: Pengliff
cobblemon.species.pengliff.desc1: Pengliff's rock-hard head is solid enough to protect it from damage. Some Pengliff have been seen diving from ledges to crack open boulders for sport.
cobblemon.species.penglacier.name: Penglacier
cobblemon.species.penglacier.desc1: Penglacier are adept tunnelers and make their nests by digging caves out of the mountain side. Some snowy mountains have vast cave networks as a result.
cobblemon.species.bluffin.name: Bluffin
cobblemon.species.bluffin.desc1: Bluffin's wings aren't powerful enough for flight, so it wanders the snowy peaks on foot. Its long tail drags on the ground and frays at the end.
cobblemon.species.burrmudail.name: Burrmudail
cobblemon.species.burrmudail.desc1: Burrmudail's beautiful, crystalline feathers are highly sought after by collectors. If a Burrmudail bestows one to you, it is a sign of good luck.
cobblemon.species.koblin.name: Koblin
cobblemon.species.koblin.desc1: Koblin spends its entire life in tunnels deep underground. Because of this, it was long believed to be just a myth told by miners.
cobblemon.species.koberus.name: Koberus
cobblemon.species.koberus.desc1: Often the cause of brush fires, Koberus will light its surroundings on fire, creating a thick cloud of smoke in order to disorient its opponents.
cobblemon.species.kobalt.name: Kobalt
cobblemon.species.kobalt.desc1: By choosing to stay in the caves, Kobalt has lost its eyesight. This has enhanced its other senses, which it uses to excavate complex tunnel systems.
cobblemon.species.pebblosa.name: Pebblosa
cobblemon.species.pebblosa.desc1: It loves to collect rocks from different mountains and caves by carrying them in its mouth. When threatened, Pebblosa will spit them at other Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.terratetra.name: Terratetra
cobblemon.species.terratetra.desc1: Terratetra use their claws to harvest rocks from deep-within the earth. They use these rocks to make walls and to hurl them at potential threats.
cobblemon.species.gigaard.name: Gigaard
cobblemon.species.gigaard.desc1: It uses its claws to carve slabs of granite and crystals from cliff faces to wear as armor. No two Gigaard have the same armor plating.
cobblemon.species.cowatti.name: Cowatti
cobblemon.species.cowatti.desc1: Cowatti uses its tail to detect signals of varying frequencies. It can hone in on these signals to locate food, water, and even shelter.
cobblemon.species.snome.name: Snome
cobblemon.species.snome.desc1: Snome is very shy and often hides under the snow. When it hides on slopes, it may accidentally roll downhill, picking up more and more snow on the way down.
cobblemon.species.snogre.name: Snogre
cobblemon.species.snogre.desc1: Snogre is incredibly reclusive, living in remote valleys and cliff-sides. Villages pass down stories of them appearing to save travelers lost in blizzards.
cobblemon.species.taomarin.name: Taomarin
cobblemon.species.taomarin.desc1: Taomarin constantly stands and moves with perfect balance, even in strong winds or uneven ground. Nothing seems to distract it from deep meditation.
cobblemon.species.orangutao.name: Orangutao
cobblemon.species.orangutao.desc1: Orangutao are often found solemnly meditating in the wilderness. It is thought that they seek to obtain inner and outer balance in all things.
cobblemon.species.larvabidae.name: Larvabidae
cobblemon.species.larvabidae.desc1: Larvabidae follows orders given to it by fully evolved members of the swarm. Its evolution is determined by which role it is most successful in.
cobblemon.species.caranox.name: Caranox
cobblemon.species.caranox.desc1: Caranox defends its home aggressively, attacking anything it sees as a threat. It often assaults bigger Pokémon and sprays them with burning acids.
cobblemon.species.carajoule.name: Carajoule
cobblemon.species.carajoule.desc1: Carajoule tend to serve as sentries for the hive. It can use its tail to flash signals or warnings and to attack foes with powerful jolts of electricity.
cobblemon.species.caracrust.name: Caracrust
cobblemon.species.caracrust.desc1: Because of its heavy carapace, it is a very slow mover. It uses its tough and sturdy defensive capabilities to protect fragile Larvabidae from harm.
cobblemon.species.musburry.name: Musburry
cobblemon.species.musburry.desc1: Because this Pokémon grows delicious berries, it is often preyed upon by Berratel. Some Musburry try to exist with Berratel symbiotically.
cobblemon.species.musbushel.name: Musbushel
cobblemon.species.musbushel.desc1: Musbushel does not give up the berries it grows easily. When it does, however, it is not only a sign of trust, but also one of friendship and staunch loyalty.
cobblemon.species.berratel.name: Berratel
cobblemon.species.berratel.desc1: Berratel eats so many berries that its fur is permanently stained. It waits for other Pokémon to gather berries, and then mugs them for an easy meal.
cobblemon.species.growmeo.name: Growmeo
cobblemon.species.growmeo.desc1: Growmeo scurry through flowerbeds in search of a Tuliep. However, they are painfully shy and rarely work up the courage to actually approach one.
cobblemon.species.montegrew.name: Montegrew
cobblemon.species.montegrew.desc1: When Montegrew falls out of love, it turns bitter and spiteful. It will begin shunning the Capulilly it once loved, whom it now sees as vain and pompous.
cobblemon.species.tuliep.name: Tuliep
cobblemon.species.tuliep.desc1: Tuliep loves nothing more than the attention of a Growmeo. If a Tuliep is seen blushing, it invariably means one is nearby.
cobblemon.species.capulilly.name: Capulilly
cobblemon.species.capulilly.desc1: When a Capulilly ceases loving its partner, it becomes haughty and cruel. It treats its former love Montegrew with disrespect, believing it to be callous and unfeeling.
cobblemon.species.dreamdery.name: Dreamdery
cobblemon.species.dreamdery.desc1: Despite its adorable looks, Dreamdery is a voracious predator. It devours the dreams of people, leaving its victims disoriented and fatigued.
cobblemon.species.macabra.name: Macabra
cobblemon.species.macabra.desc1: Macabra hunts Dreamdery for their wool. It has developed an immunity to their attacks, making it popular among people dealing with Dreamdery problems.
cobblemon.species.kertruffle.name: Kertruffle
cobblemon.species.kertruffle.desc1: Needing little more than water and air to live, Kertruffle can adapt to hostile environments where few other Pokémon would survive.
cobblemon.species.mosshroom.name: Mosshroom
cobblemon.species.mosshroom.desc1: Mosshroom is commonly mistaken for a grass hill. When something bumps into it, it releases spores before shuffling off to find a quiet place to sleep.
cobblemon.species.lumishroom.name: Lumishroom
cobblemon.species.lumishroom.desc1: The light from a Lumishroom’s caps can illuminate even the darkest caverns. Lumishroom use these lights to talk with one another from far away.
cobblemon.species.perishroom.name: Perishroom
cobblemon.species.perishroom.desc1: Perishroom never seems to need to eat or drink in order to survive, and rarely moves. The spores it releases when attacked are fatal in even small doses.
cobblemon.species.rocano.name: Rocano
cobblemon.species.rocano.desc1: Rocano is able to store up pressure inside its body by eating ore. When it is startled, it will release it all at once in a jet of magma to scare away foes.
cobblemon.species.volcaroc.name: Volcaroc
cobblemon.species.volcaroc.desc1: Volcaroc live very deep in the earth and are a rare sight close to the surface. While digging, they leave long tubes behind them as if formed by magma.
cobblemon.species.volcoalder.name: Volcoalder
cobblemon.species.volcoalder.desc1: Volcoalder claim entire hotspots as their personal domains. The strongest Volcoalder use mighty eruptions to protect their lands.
cobblemon.species.pounther.name: Pounther
cobblemon.species.pounther.desc1: Pounther plays with its siblings by sneaking up on them and then jumping them when they least expect it. This game serves as training for the hunt.
cobblemon.species.jaguile.name: Jaguile
cobblemon.species.jaguile.desc1: Jaguile are incredibly patient hunters. They use specialized appendages to detect changes in the wind, and pounce on their prey with blinding speed.
cobblemon.species.neureka.name: Neureka
cobblemon.species.neureka.desc1: Neureka draws energy from active minds and creative thinking. When a nearby person has a novel idea, this social Pokemon begins to shine brightly.
cobblemon.species.cerebrulb.name: Cerebrulb
cobblemon.species.cerebrulb.desc1: Cerebrulb's light stimulates brain cell activity to an extraordinary degree. This trait makes it a common companion for scientists and academics.
cobblemon.species.peppit.name: Peppit
cobblemon.species.peppit.desc1: Peppit seeks out the spiciest berries to make its Fire attacks burn hotter. Groups of Peppit love to play in dry leaves, often causing small fires.
cobblemon.species.hoppanero.name: Hoppanero
cobblemon.species.hoppanero.desc1: Hoppanero has few natural predators due to its spicy fur. When Hoppanero gather in large groups, they have been known to cause heat waves.
cobblemon.species.scovalope.name: Scovalope
cobblemon.species.scovalope.desc1: Scovalope is highly adept at evading detection. The fruits on its horns may fall off, and are considered both a lucky charm and a delicacy.
cobblemon.species.pawter.name: Pawter
cobblemon.species.pawter.desc1: A loyal companion and a skilled swimmer, Pawter is a common partner for sailors and lifeguards. It can detect storms and warn others before they arrive.
cobblemon.species.hurricanine.name: Hurricanine
cobblemon.species.hurricanine.desc1: Hurricanine becomes more and more energetic shortly before a storm hits. When angry, its growls are so loud and harsh, they evoke the rumble of thunder.
cobblemon.species.skullarva.name: Skullarva
cobblemon.species.skullarva.desc1: Skullarva spends its early life hidden away in damp caves and crevasses. It tries to scare away predators and trainers by mimicking the cries of stronger Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.maskoon.name: Maskoon
cobblemon.species.maskoon.desc1: It imitates the cries of other Pokémon, but warps them so they sound morbid and unnatural. The pattern on its back is used to scare off predators.
cobblemon.species.mortasque.name: Mortasque
cobblemon.species.mortasque.desc1: It can make human-like sounds to scare away predators and unnerve those that enter its domain. Many 'haunted' houses are merely nests for Mortasque.
cobblemon.species.vectol.name: Vectol
cobblemon.species.vectol.desc1: Vectol was a computer virus that had infected the PC storage system. The process that converts data into matter has given it a physical form.
cobblemon.species.vectol2.name: Vectol.2
cobblemon.species.vectol2.desc1: Exposed to an unknown code, Vectol has upgraded to Vectol.2. It feeds by using its stinger to download data, leaving computers a corrupt mess afterwards.
cobblemon.species.bouwee.name: Bouwee
cobblemon.species.bouwee.desc1: Bouwee's tail lets it drift peacefully near the surface. However, the bright colors often attract predators, so it will release a jet of water to escape.
cobblemon.species.scubug.name: Scubug
cobblemon.species.scubug.desc1: Scubug's sturdy exoskeleton protects it from crushing deep sea pressure. Its antennae emit powerful light that allows it to navigate the darkest depths.
cobblemon.species.totter.name: Totter
cobblemon.species.totter.desc1: Totter’s skin requires constant moisture, so it makes its home near riverbanks. It likes to soak up water with its tail and splash other Pokémon with it.
cobblemon.species.cascotta.name: Cascotta
cobblemon.species.cascotta.desc1: Wild Cascotta have been known to attract attention by leaping out of streams and performing displays of aerial acrobatics at high speeds.
cobblemon.species.lutrajet.name: Lutrajet
cobblemon.species.lutrajet.desc1: Dwelling in the deepest reaches of the clearest pools, Lutrajet moves as if it were one with the water. There are few who have witnessed this elegant dance.
cobblemon.species.alpint.name: Alpint
cobblemon.species.alpint.desc1: The sapling at the end of its trunk acts as a personal weathervane. By holding it up to the wind, Alpint can tell where the weather will be most favorable.
cobblemon.species.forusk.name: Forusk
cobblemon.species.forusk.desc1: While normally peaceful when soaking up sunlight, Forusk is quick to anger if approached. It swings its hammer-like trunk with enough force to level houses.
cobblemon.species.platypow.name: Platypow
cobblemon.species.platypow.desc1: Predators that don’t pay heed to Platypow because of its tiny size are quickly surprised by its fiery nature and its remarkably strong punches.
cobblemon.species.platikhao.name: Platikhao
cobblemon.species.platikhao.desc1: Platikhao has venomous barbs hidden on its elbows and knees. It uses them to hurl furious strikes against its foes, and then lets the poison do its work.
cobblemon.species.cuppy.name: Cuppy
cobblemon.species.cuppy.desc1: Schools of Cuppy gather in circles when sleeping, burying their noses in the sea bed. Many poems have been written about these strange underwater tea parties.
cobblemon.species.fettlekish.name: Fettlekish
cobblemon.species.fettlekish.desc1: Fettlekish stores water in its body and controls its temperature to let it sink or float underwater. It can also release the water in a scalding hot blast.
cobblemon.species.shibalbat.name: Shibalbat
cobblemon.species.shibalbat.desc1: Legend states that Shibalbat guards the entrance to the Underworld. It appears to be a statue until exposed to moonlight.
cobblemon.species.nobunata.name: Nobunata
cobblemon.species.nobunata.desc1: Nobunata fights fearlessly and honorably, standing up for the weak and defenseless. When defeat seems inevitable, it will explode in a flurry of treats.
cobblemon.species.psybex.name: Psybex
cobblemon.species.psybex.desc1: Psybex takes long journeys to mountain tops, searching for inner peace. Through meditation, it is able to see into the hearts of humans and Pokémon alike.
cobblemon.species.gnuru.name: Gnuru
cobblemon.species.gnuru.desc1: Its horn amplifies its psychic powers, allowing Gnuru to communicate with parts unknown. It meditates daily to commune with these voices from afar.
cobblemon.species.flowger.name: Flowger
cobblemon.species.flowger.desc1: When Flowger gather in great numbers, their songs form a joyous symphony. Many romantics believe that hearing a Flowger sing means one will find true love.
cobblemon.species.blue_flowger.name: Flowger
cobblemon.species.blue_flowger.desc1: When Flowger gather in great numbers, their songs form a joyous symphony. Many romantics believe that hearing a Flowger sing means one will find true love.
cobblemon.species.bullotus.name: Bullotus
cobblemon.species.bullotus.desc1: Bullotus’s booming cry can be heard for miles around. When resting, it floats on the water and looks up, absorbing sunlight with the petals around its neck.
cobblemon.species.blue_bullotus.name: Bullotus
cobblemon.species.blue_bullotus.desc1: Bullotus’s booming cry can be heard for miles around. When resting, it floats on the water and looks up, absorbing sunlight with the petals around its neck.
cobblemon.species.burrowl.name: Burrowl
cobblemon.species.burrowl.desc1: Burrowl’s heavy wings prevent it from flying, but it uses them as shovels to dig underground. It also uses its wings to protect small Pokémon from sandstorms.
cobblemon.species.magowl.name: Magowl
cobblemon.species.magowl.desc1: Its wings are broad and powerful, yet it never flies. It is said that Magowl is weighed down by the arcane secrets hidden within its cloak of feathers.
cobblemon.species.craliber.name: Craliber
cobblemon.species.craliber.desc1: Hatched near undersea mineral deposits, this Pokémon develops a sturdy shell. Its body rotates, helping it maintain course at high speeds.
cobblemon.species.crawglock.name: Crawglock
cobblemon.species.crawglock.desc1: Crawglock hides underneath rocks to guard its offspring. A rapid click of its claws releases explosive blasts of heat and light with a loud bang.
cobblemon.species.leafish.name: Leafish
cobblemon.species.leafish.desc1: When food is scarce, it floats sideways on the water's surface and absorbs sunlight for energy. Bug Pokémon often land on it, mistaking Leafish for a real leaf.
cobblemon.species.chlorofin.name: Chlorofin
cobblemon.species.chlorofin.desc1: Chlorofin's natural camouflage makes it difficult to find in the wild, but once encountered, it'll display the playful, friendly attitude for which it's known.
cobblemon.species.quibble.name: Quibble
cobblemon.species.quibble.desc1: Irascible and immature, Quibble squawks loudly when it doesn't get its way. It picks on smaller Pokémon but it's quick to flee when its targets fight back.
cobblemon.species.fowattle.name: Fowattle
cobblemon.species.fowattle.desc1: As Fowattle grows bigger and bolder, it becomes somewhat of a bully. Rather than foraging on its own, it prefers to steal food from weaker Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.turkistador.name: Turkistador
cobblemon.species.turkistador.desc1: Turkistador often moves into other Pokémon's nests, stubbornly refusing to leave until the old inhabitant gives up and flees.
cobblemon.species.sedirrot.name: Sedirrot
cobblemon.species.sedirrot.desc1: Sedirrot cleaves chunks of stone and clay from cliffsides using its axe-like beak. The excavated minerals are then consumed to strengthen its rigid hide.
cobblemon.species.condesa.name: Condesa
cobblemon.species.condesa.desc1: Condesa is known to make entire canyons its territory. It has been found to carve images of things it likes into cliffsides.
cobblemon.species.cardinite.name: Cardinite
cobblemon.species.cardinite.desc1: Though it can fly, Cardinite prefers to chase its prey around on foot, where it is more comfortable. It leaves a trail of small, scorched tracks as it runs.
cobblemon.species.chardinal.name: Chardinal
cobblemon.species.chardinal.desc1: Chardinal routinely sets its own nest on fire to keep the eggs at the right temperature. When it takes off, it looks like the blazing streak of a comet.
cobblemon.species.skurrow.name: Skurrow
cobblemon.species.skurrow.desc1: Skurrow digs itself underground to find shelter from the desert heat in a series of tunnels. It hisses to alert other Skurrow when danger is approaching.
cobblemon.species.somberado.name: Somberado
cobblemon.species.somberado.desc1: Legend has it that Somberado was born of souls that got lost in the vast emptiness of the desert. Now it is forced to wander the badlands endlessly.
cobblemon.species.phlask.name: Phlask
cobblemon.species.phlask.desc1: Laboratory glassware possessed by a playful but frightening spirit. It is known to spew chemicals onto random objects to see what happens.
cobblemon.species.noxial.name: Noxial
cobblemon.species.noxial.desc1: Noxial have been discovered in both endothermic and exothermic forms. The more extreme the temperature, the more volatile the Noxial.
cobblemon.species.exothermic_noxial.name: Noxial
cobblemon.species.exothermic_noxial.desc: Noxial have been discovered in both endothermic and exothermic forms. The more extreme the temperature, the more volatile the Noxial.
cobblemon.species.fumighast.name: Fumighast
cobblemon.species.fumighast.desc1: Within Fumighast are residual chemicals from its time as a Noxial. Using them as catalysts, Fumighast can recreate spontaneous, volatile reactions at will.
cobblemon.species.atomite.name: Atomite
cobblemon.species.atomite.desc1: Atomite is the smallest known Pokémon. Sometimes a big group of Atomite will group together to mimic the shape of something else.
cobblemon.species.orbatom.name: Orbatom
cobblemon.species.orbatom.desc1: Orbatom is able to discern objects as small as subatomic particles. It has enabled scientists to understand nuclear physics at a fundamental level.
cobblemon.species.squink.name: Squink
cobblemon.species.squink.desc1: When confronted, Squink sprays its foes with noxious black ink to escape. While toxic in high doses, it has a distinct flavor and is used in a variety of dishes.
cobblemon.species.squidrift.name: Squidrift
cobblemon.species.squidrift.desc1: Squidrift is able to fly by expelling noxious gases at high pressure. Its tentacles are delicacies, but highly toxic if prepared incorrectly.
cobblemon.species.boarealis.name: Boarealis
cobblemon.species.boarealis.desc1: Boarealis' psychic powers produce vivid light shows when they interact with magnetic fields. The brilliance of the mane indicates an individual's strength.
cobblemon.species.chelonite.name: Chelonite
cobblemon.species.chelonite.desc1: Chelonite uses its psychic control over gravity to levitate itself above the ground. It will sometimes get confused which way is up and float upside-down.
cobblemon.species.galaxagos.name: Galaxagos
cobblemon.species.galaxagos.desc1: Galaxagos’ shell is so dense, it exudes a gravitational pull. At night, Chelonite swarm around it, orbiting in a spiral pattern for safety.
cobblemon.species.magnitogre.name: Magnitogre
cobblemon.species.magnitogre.desc1: Magnitogre was first discovered when factories became commonplace. It feeds on leftover industrial waste, providing a safe environment for other Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.minarac.name: Minarac
cobblemon.species.minarac.desc1: Minarac digs elaborate tunnels to confuse its prey. Its constant search for gemstones also makes it a valuable companion for treasure-hunters.
cobblemon.species.trenchula.name: Trenchula
cobblemon.species.trenchula.desc1: Trenchula uses its powerful mandibles to drill into the earth, forming a pitfall trap to ensnare its prey. It often work alongside miners underground.
cobblemon.species.pottle.name: Pottle
cobblemon.species.pottle.desc1: It deviously infiltrates homes and fools unwary humans into caring for it. If discovered, Pottle will resist removal by stubbornly rooting into place.
cobblemon.species.trikotta.name: Trikotta
cobblemon.species.trikotta.desc1: Trikotta actively seeks out the soil with the most nutrients. It will uproot crops from farmland and then defend its stolen land against angered farmers.
cobblemon.species.terrorcotta.name: Terrorcotta
cobblemon.species.terrorcotta.desc1: Terrorcotta is too huge for standard containers. In order to not have their houses carried away, locals make giant clay pots for it to inhabit instead.
cobblemon.species.pueblant.name: Pueblant
cobblemon.species.pueblant.desc1: The sprawling colonies built by Pueblant have inspired human architects for millennia. These structures are harder than concrete, lasting for generations.
cobblemon.species.cahokisect.name: Cahokisect
cobblemon.species.cahokisect.desc1: Cahokisect's bejeweled carapace made it a symbol of wealth in ancient times. As a result, it is commonly found in the tombs of nobility and royalty.
cobblemon.species.cobrasket.name: Cobrasket
cobblemon.species.cobrasket.desc1: Its resting, coiled body resembles a basket. Many unsuspecting merchants have been startled when they reached for one, only to be met with loud hissing.
cobblemon.species.charmbra.name: Charmbra
cobblemon.species.charmbra.desc1: Charmbra passes air through the holes on its body to create a melody that hypnotizes its prey. The dazed targets are unable to escape its toxic fangs.
cobblemon.species.cairup.name: Cairup
cobblemon.species.cairup.desc1: When it thinks nobody is looking, Cairup has been known to have one-sided talks with its tail. The eye on its forehead stays closed until it's fully developed.
cobblemon.species.kairoglyph.name: Kairoglyph
cobblemon.species.kairoglyph.desc1: Kairoglyph values secrets and riddles above all else. The eye on its tail can reveal the innermost secrets of both humans and Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.necronite.name: Necronite
cobblemon.species.necronite.desc1: Necronite emits a strange frequency as it floats about the ancient ruins it inhabits. Making contact with this Pokémon can leave one lightheaded.
cobblemon.species.gravollum.name: Gravollum
cobblemon.species.gravollum.desc1: Gravollum will sleep motionless for thousands of years, only to awaken and relocate. This has led to ancient monuments seemingly vanishing overnight.
cobblemon.species.diloweed.name: Diloweed
cobblemon.species.diloweed.desc1: As food in the desert is scarce, the plates on Diloweed's back absorb solar energy. It curls itself up into a ball and lets the wind carry it if it is tired.
cobblemon.species.pangolash.name: Pangolash
cobblemon.species.pangolash.desc1: The plates on Pangolash's back have not only hardened to be highly durable, but also developed sharp edges capable of shredding nearly anything to pieces.
cobblemon.species.ignishell.name: Ignishell
cobblemon.species.ignishell.desc1: Ignishell is still young, so its shell has not completely formed. In battle it worriedly covers its soft underbelly, which is very susceptible to attacks.
cobblemon.species.shelosene.name: Shelosene
cobblemon.species.shelosene.desc1: Shelosene proudly displays its carapace to show its endurance. The Shelosene with the least damaged shell is idolised by the nest.
cobblemon.species.flarrapin.name: Flarrapin
cobblemon.species.flarrapin.desc1: Flarrapin exposes its shell to extreme heat to repair and strengthen it. It is said that the average Flarrapin’s shell has been completely reforged 5 times.
cobblemon.species.desoula.name: Desoula
cobblemon.species.desoula.desc1: Desoula feeds on the souls of creatures who have become exhausted by the desert. This nimble Pokémon zips around the desert sands in search of food.
cobblemon.species.necrow.name: Necrow
cobblemon.species.necrow.desc1: Necrow has been known to lure people into the desert in an attempt to make them get lost. It then quietly watches from afar, awaiting its prey's demise.
cobblemon.species.vultergyst.name: Vultergyst
cobblemon.species.vultergyst.desc1: Vultergyst is considered a harbinger of death. It scours the desert skies in search of fading souls then puts them to rest in its cloak of black feathers.
cobblemon.species.dinkywink.name: Dinkywink
cobblemon.species.dinkywink.desc1: While Dinkywink's mouth contains huge, razor sharp teeth, it has yet to develop the strength to utilize them. As such, it prefers to hunt by ramming into prey.
cobblemon.species.dunkywunkr.name: Dunkywunkr
cobblemon.species.dunkywunkr.desc1: After its legs had fully developed, Dunkywunkr was able to become the apex predator not only in the seas from which it emerged, but also on dry land.
cobblemon.species.calphite.name: Calphite
cobblemon.species.calphite.desc1: Calphite spent many of its early years with its mother. Despite its massive size, it scared easily and trampled much in its path when running in fear.
cobblemon.species.indrolith.name: Indrolith
cobblemon.species.indrolith.desc1: Very few things can penetrate Indrolith's impervious hide. This earthen behemoth ferociously defends its own when under attack.
cobblemon.species.solacari.name: Solacari
cobblemon.species.solacari.desc1: Ancient peoples venerated Solacari as the herald of the rising sun. Kings would keep many of them in hopes of a long reign.
cobblemon.species.nurshary.name: Nurshary
cobblemon.species.nurshary.desc1: Nurshary’s maternal instinct extends beyond its own children. It will often adopt sick or injured Pokémon, caring for them until they return to health.
cobblemon.species.loneleaf.name: Loneleaf
cobblemon.species.loneleaf.desc1: Loneleaf considers itself to be ugly and creepy. It carves a wooden mask with a large smile on it to make friends. Sadly, this only alienates it even further.
cobblemon.species.forthorn.name: Forthorn
cobblemon.species.forthorn.desc1: Forthorn masquerades as a guardian of the forest, scaring off intruders to awe its fellow Pokémon. In reality, it is quite bashful and desires acceptance.
cobblemon.species.coltergeist.name: Coltergeist
cobblemon.species.coltergeist.desc1: The icy blue gazes of Coltergeist herds can often be seen in thick fog patches. Their eerie cries not only cause chills, but also strange, indescribable dreams.
cobblemon.species.fantasmare.name: Fantasmare
cobblemon.species.fantasmare.desc1: Fantasmare wanders in the mountains and hills where it stalks lone travellers. It is said to haunt the dreams of those who have seen it.
cobblemon.species.chihaha.name: Chihaha
cobblemon.species.chihaha.desc1: Chihaha loves nothing more than to make people laugh. It may look silly and clumsy to some, but in reality, it takes fake pratfalls for the sake of humor.
cobblemon.species.howlequin.name: Howlequin
cobblemon.species.howlequin.desc1: Despite lacking thumbs, its dexterity is superior to humans'. Wild Howlequin often taunt trainers by juggling the balls that were too weak to catch it.
cobblemon.species.chegrin.name: Chegrin
cobblemon.species.chegrin.desc1: Chegrin takes delight in playing tricks on smaller Pokémon, scaring them with its flexible tail, but all too often, it ends up accidentally scaring itself.
cobblemon.species.cheshade.name: Cheshade
cobblemon.species.cheshade.desc1: Cheshade's mane resembles a toothy smile. Hunting in the dark, it appears only as a sinister grin, striking prey with its shadowy claws as they are transfixed.
cobblemon.species.doppole.name: Doppole
cobblemon.species.doppole.desc1: Doppole wears a half of a broken Poké Ball as a sturdy improvised helmet. Whilst it might act bold and spunky, in reality, it loves being coddled.
cobblemon.species.artifish.name: Artifish
cobblemon.species.artifish.desc1: Despite its predator-like appearance, Artifish is very kind and laid back. It uses its Poké Ball bait to play with other Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.thoraxe.name: Thoraxe
cobblemon.species.thoraxe.desc1: It uses its axe-like claws to remove trees and other obstacles. When its abdomen is filled with water, Thoraxe puts out fires with pressurized streams.
cobblemon.species.pomparunt.name: Pomparunt
cobblemon.species.pomparunt.desc1: Pomparunt is commonly found skulking around densely populated cities. It scavenges for food in small packs and often fights with others over scraps.
cobblemon.species.pompagoon.name: Pompagoon
cobblemon.species.pompagoon.desc1: Being much stronger and bolder, gangs of Pompagoon will bully Pomparunt out of food. Oftentimes they will then fight among themselves for the stolen loot.
cobblemon.species.hyekuza.name: Hyekuza
cobblemon.species.hyekuza.desc1: Fiercely proud and protective of its hairdo, the Hyekuza with the largest and most extravagant pompadour is considered the leader of the pack.
cobblemon.species.erycoon.name: Erycoon
cobblemon.species.erycoon.desc1: Erycoon is constantly taking care of the forest it calls its home. It carries seeds and berries in its pouch-like tail to be planted or fed to weaker Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.leukoon.name: Leukoon
cobblemon.species.leukoon.desc1: Scientists call Leukoon the immune system of nature. It is able to engulf any threat to its habitat using its massive, void-like maw.
cobblemon.species.toxito.name: Toxito
cobblemon.species.toxito.desc1: The bane of swamps and other wet places, Toxito is dangerous in swarms. It is individually considered a pest, though, and is deterred with ease.
cobblemon.species.sanguito.name: Sanguito
cobblemon.species.sanguito.desc1: Sanguito's antennae can sense warmth, helping it find prey in its dimly-lit swamp habitat. It emits a numbing toxin that keeps it undetected while it feeds.
cobblemon.species.orett.name: Orett
cobblemon.species.orett.desc1: Born deep underground, Orett feeds on ore to keep its metallic shell strong. The composition of its body depends on what kind of ore it feeds on.
cobblemon.species.anvelid.name: Anvelid
cobblemon.species.anvelid.desc1: Anvelid incubates inside mineral-rich cave walls in order to grow. However, it will ferociously attack any Pokémon or people who disturb its hibernation.
cobblemon.species.magroplex.name: Magroplex
cobblemon.species.magroplex.desc1: Notoriously protective of its community, Magroplex will go so far as to collapse mines approaching its nests. Its durable body allows it to dig miles underground.
cobblemon.species.viipii.name: Viipii
cobblemon.species.viipii.desc1: Although they are friendly to most Pokémon, in the wild, groups of Viipii are known to bicker and fight over nothing for days on end.
cobblemon.species.chilloth.name: Chilloth
cobblemon.species.chilloth.desc1: Chilloth floats calmly in the water by connecting its arms to make an inner tube. It lets swimmers hold on when they need to catch their breath.
cobblemon.species.soakoth.name: Soakoth
cobblemon.species.soakoth.desc1: Soakoth drifts nonchalantly along river rapids as if they were a gentle stream. Pokémon that can't swim sometimes climb on its belly to cross bodies of water.
cobblemon.species.chayan.name: Chayan
cobblemon.species.chayan.desc1: Chayan is a born fighter, sparring with others mere hours after birth. It competes with others in challenges of skill and strength, striving to improve.
cobblemon.species.macuarrior.name: Macuarrior
cobblemon.species.macuarrior.desc1: The edges of Macuarrior's blades are extremely sharp. Through constant honing, these blades can effortlessly cut through concrete.
cobblemon.species.ocerumi.name: Ocerumi
cobblemon.species.ocerumi.desc1: Ocerumi encases its hands in special clay, baking them in harsh sun. When dried, these stone gauntlets can resist even Ocerumi's earth-shattering punch.
cobblemon.species.fortifry.name: Fortifry
cobblemon.species.fortifry.desc1: Only Fortifry that learn to care for others will evolve. Though they are numerous and hardy, few Fortifry evolve due to their inherently selfish nature.
cobblemon.species.oarwish.name: Oarwish
cobblemon.species.oarwish.desc1: Oarwish is known to emerge only to help people in need. This has gained it a reputation amongst sailors that it is a sign of luck and can grant wishes.
cobblemon.species.smashiary.name: Smashiary
cobblemon.species.smashiary.desc1: Smashiary's reckless fighting style makes use of its long legs and aerial superiority to swoop onto enemies in a flurry of bone-shattering kicks.
cobblemon.species.slatic.name: Slatic
cobblemon.species.slatic.desc1: Slatic has not yet mastered its powers of light distortion. As a result, its body parts will suddenly appear out of nowhere as its camouflage falters.
cobblemon.species.telsion.name: Telsion
cobblemon.species.telsion.desc1: Telsion's lightning fast tongue carries an impressive electric current that cooks small bugs alive and can stun even the heftiest of opponents.
cobblemon.species.chameleohm.name: Chameleohm
cobblemon.species.chameleohm.desc1: By using its ability to manipulate electromagnetic waves, Chameleohm can disrupt the light around it and render itself invisible to the naked eye.
cobblemon.species.glauqua.name: Glauqua
cobblemon.species.glauqua.desc1: Even though Glauqua is highly venomous, it is known to be playful and enjoy making new friends. Still, one should try to stay away from its poisonous horns.
cobblemon.species.hydranticus.name: Hydranticus
cobblemon.species.hydranticus.desc1: Hydranticus is a curious Pokémon that loves soaring behind ships for weeks on end, happily absorbing the toxic runoff left in their wakes.
cobblemon.species.lintle.name: Lintle
cobblemon.species.lintle.desc1: The luster of Lintle's mane is indicative of its health. From birth, it always travels as part of a pair, and remain with its partner its whole life.
cobblemon.species.silkinder.name: Silkinder
cobblemon.species.silkinder.desc1: The ribbons on Silkinder's neck are very sensitive, and shine in the moonlight. Silkinder often entwine ribbons as an affectionate gesture.
cobblemon.species.paramoth.name: Paramoth
cobblemon.species.paramoth.desc1: On rare occasions, Paramoth will cloud together and perform a complicated, colorful dance. Some say this is related to the movements of the moon.
cobblemon.species.parapy.name: Parapy
cobblemon.species.parapy.desc1: Parapy grows inside the mouth of a fish and replaces the tongue of its host. It uses its host's body as a trojan horse, attacking unwitting prey as it swims by.
cobblemon.species.mawasite.name: Mawasite
cobblemon.species.mawasite.desc1: Mawasite has now fully overtaken its host's mind and body. By seizing complete control, the bodies have become inseparable.
cobblemon.species.chimpoca.name: Chimpoca
cobblemon.species.chimpoca.desc1: Chimpoca, though typically naïve and clumsy, all aspire to become the leaders of their troops. Their brazen actions often lead them into trouble.
cobblemon.species.simayan.name: Simayan
cobblemon.species.simayan.desc1: Simayan spend all their time sparring with each other. Their aim is to show that they are the strongest in the group, and thus become the next leader.
cobblemon.species.monkezuma.name: Monkezuma
cobblemon.species.monkezuma.desc1: There can be only one Monkezuma per troop, who leads the rest with an iron fist. If another Simayan evolves, the two battle, and the loser is exiled.
cobblemon.species.enigmite.name: Enigmite
cobblemon.species.enigmite.desc1: Enigmite selects a round stone and rolls it around tirelessly. When the stone becomes perfectly smooth, Enigmite gains psychic powers.
cobblemon.species.enigmantis.name: Enigmantis
cobblemon.species.enigmantis.desc1: Enigmantis uses its perfectly rounded gem to focus its psychic powers. Robbing it of its stone leaves it sluggish and listless.
cobblemon.species.arjibi.name: Arjibi
cobblemon.species.arjibi.desc1: Arjibi absorbs light with its colored fins to produce energy. In bright light, it flits about energetically, so fast that film barely registers it as a blur.
cobblemon.species.royjibiv.name: Royjibiv
cobblemon.species.royjibiv.desc1: Royjibiv's iridescent scales reflect and amplify sunlight. When flying overhead, this causes it to bathe the ground below it in every color imaginable.
cobblemon.species.barracute.name: Barracute
cobblemon.species.barracute.desc1: Barracute hides in the narrow openings between rocks to protect its soft body. It will stick its head out and bite anything unlucky enough to get near it.
cobblemon.species.jawgodon.name: Jawgodon
cobblemon.species.jawgodon.desc1: Despite being a fast swimmer, Jawgodon prefers stealing others' prey and eating carrion rather than hunting. It will search on land if food is scarce.
cobblemon.species.drosire.name: Drosire
cobblemon.species.drosire.desc1: Drosire cannot draw nutrients from the soil, so it uses its vines to hang from trees and catch bugs. Unaware humans may accidentally walk into it face first.
cobblemon.species.sunduke.name: Sunduke
cobblemon.species.sunduke.desc1: Sunduke lead groups of Drosire in return for reverence. As such, they have long been a symbol of royalty, and ancient Urobians fashioned their regalia on them.
cobblemon.species.wispern.name: Wispern
cobblemon.species.wispern.desc1: It is common to find a procession of Wispern at a funeral. It is believed that they are there to safely guide the deceased to the afterlife.
cobblemon.species.phantern.name: Phantern
cobblemon.species.phantern.desc1: Phantern congregate in large groups at times of celebration. Oddly, its ghostly lights are known to appear at both festivals and funerals.
cobblemon.species.glocto.name: Glocto
cobblemon.species.glocto.desc1: Glocto’s molten innards form constantly shifting bubbles of glowing lava. This strange, yet beautiful phenomenon is visible from above the ocean’s surface.
cobblemon.species.lavoon.name: Lavoon
cobblemon.species.lavoon.desc1: Lavoon releases molten secretions from its blowhole, which gradually rise to the surface and cool. People collect them to use as alternative fuel.
cobblemon.species.gilla.name: Gilla
cobblemon.species.gilla.desc1: From the moment it hatches, Gilla must fend for itself. It hunts on its own, even in its infancy, using poison glands filled with toxic venom.
cobblemon.species.hornizard.name: Hornizard
cobblemon.species.hornizard.desc1: Hornizard’s spines contain a potent venom, while its skin secretes an acidic compound. Due to these defenses, it has almost no natural predators.
cobblemon.species.ankillosore.name: Ankillosore
cobblemon.species.ankillosore.desc1: Ankillosore will let attackers strike its thick hide so it can line up a blow with its tail. If the impact doesn't fell the foe, the venom surely will.
cobblemon.species.bazilisk.name: Bazilisk
cobblemon.species.bazilisk.desc1: While sunbathing, Bazilisk lays in tall grass so that only its dorsal leaf is visible. When prey passes by, however, it jumps up and snaps at it quickly.
cobblemon.species.ornitherb.name: Ornitherb
cobblemon.species.ornitherb.desc1: Ornitherb work together to steal eggs from other Pokémon's nests. A few will distract the parents while others make off with their target.
cobblemon.species.dilophlora.name: Dilophlora
cobblemon.species.dilophlora.desc1: Dilophlora will commit every rock and plant in its jungle to memory. That way it can swiftly avoid any obstacle while chasing down its prey at high speeds.
cobblemon.species.baboom.name: Baboom
cobblemon.species.baboom.desc1: Baboom is vicious towards any outsiders. It can build up an electric charge by rapidly slapping its own rear, which causes thunderous blasts of lightning.
cobblemon.species.icetope.name: Icetope
cobblemon.species.icetope.desc1: Icetope's innards are in the constant danger of overheating and melting down. To counteract this, it maintains an extremely low body temperature.
cobblemon.species.chillnobyl.name: Chillnobyl
cobblemon.species.chillnobyl.desc1: Chillnobyl appears near radioactive sites and absorbs the radiation there. It is often used to clean up nuclear waste and seek out leaks in nuclear reactors.
cobblemon.species.wendingo.name: Wendingo
cobblemon.species.wendingo.desc1: Wendingo lives in a tight-knit pack. It uses its coloration to blend in with its snowy habitat, then cooperates with the pack to take down larger prey.
cobblemon.species.carnibal.name: Carnibal
cobblemon.species.carnibal.desc1: Carnibal's ravaging hunger is never satisfied. It can't stand the thought of sharing food with others, so it leaves the pack to hunt on its own.
cobblemon.species.luchito.name: Luchito
cobblemon.species.luchito.desc1: Luchito practice grabs and throws on rocks to develop their own signature move. Despite their size, their tail stores a powerful electric charge.
cobblemon.species.eluchadon.name: Eluchadon
cobblemon.species.eluchadon.desc1: When Eluchadon is challenged, it holds nothing back against its foe. It builds up static energy in its mane to unleash in an electrifying finishing move.
cobblemon.species.grolem.name: Grolem
cobblemon.species.grolem.desc1: Acting as a sentry for temples, Grolem forms a symbiosis with the moss and foliage it wears. Roots run through it like circuitry to deliver solar energy.
cobblemon.species.comossus.name: Comossus
cobblemon.species.comossus.desc1: Comossus is theorized to have served as a sentinel for bygone civilizations. It is able to focus natural energies into powerful destructive beams.
cobblemon.species.larvyn.name: Larvyn
cobblemon.species.larvyn.desc1: Larvyn's appetite is ravenous. It will eat almost anything, be it wood, rocks or even metal. It uses the nutrients to slowly develop a sturdy shell.
cobblemon.species.dracoon.name: Dracoon
cobblemon.species.dracoon.desc1: Having encased itself in a rigid shell, Dracoon begins its transformation. It hardly moves at all, instead directing its entire attention to its growth.
cobblemon.species.basilect.name: Basilect
cobblemon.species.basilect.desc1: Basilect uses its powerful pincers to shear and jab at foes. Opposing Basilect will grapple with their pincers and try to hurl the other as far as they can.
cobblemon.species.carbite.name: Carbite
cobblemon.species.carbite.desc1: Carbite consumes minerals in excess to toughen its rocky hide. It prefers carbon, so it will occasionally go after live prey.
cobblemon.species.pressaur.name: Pressaur
cobblemon.species.pressaur.desc1: Pressaur compresses the minerals it consumes, producing so much energy that it must expel heat through the vents that run along its rugged body.
cobblemon.species.diamat.name: Diamat
cobblemon.species.diamat.desc1: In battle, Diamat refracts light through its glittering body to blind foes, then finishes them off with its powerful, unbreakable claws.
cobblemon.species.quecko.name: Quecko
cobblemon.species.quecko.desc1: Quecko is hard to find and catch; this makes it very sought after not only by trainers, but also by healers who use its leaves to make medicine.
cobblemon.species.tozecko.name: Tozecko
cobblemon.species.tozecko.desc1: Tozecko was worshipped as a god of wind and harvest in ancient times. When offered tribute, it would ensure clear skies and bountiful crops.
cobblemon.species.crakling.name: Crakling
cobblemon.species.crakling.desc1: If one hears sharp explosions with no one around, it might be a Crakling, blowing up pebbles for fun. Its tail constantly shoots bright sparks.
cobblemon.species.fuelong.name: Fuelong
cobblemon.species.fuelong.desc1: Fuelong idly rests in the clouds at day, but at night it awakes and breathes its colorful fire. From below, it looks like a display of brilliant fireworks.
cobblemon.species.draggar.name: Draggar
cobblemon.species.draggar.desc1: Draggar looks fierce from afar, but it is in fact very jovial. It enjoys swimming through even the roughest seas, unafraid of storms or large waves.
cobblemon.species.ragnarow.name: Ragnarow
cobblemon.species.ragnarow.desc1: On foggy nights, Ragnarow is often mistaken for an abandoned vessel. Sailors tell stories of the terrible shipwrecks that occur if Ragnarow is approached.
cobblemon.species.eronze.name: Eronze
cobblemon.species.eronze.desc1: Eronze's body is made from an ancient metal alloy lost to modern science. It can withstand intense heat and force without the slightest bit of damage.
cobblemon.species.erion.name: Erion
cobblemon.species.erion.desc1: Erion is an industrial titan, ravenously consuming fuel and spewing it out as toxic smog. Plants and Pokémon in its wake wither and gasp for air.
cobblemon.species.erace.name: Erace
cobblemon.species.erace.desc1: Thought to be damaged beyond repair, Erace was retrofitted with state-of-the-art technology. Its new, advanced body can even withstand atmospheric re-entry.
cobblemon.species.patama.name: Patama
cobblemon.species.patama.desc1: Patama presides over land and forests, caring for the plants and Pokémon. It perpetuates the life cycle, making sure death always brings forth new life.
cobblemon.species.machima.name: Machima
cobblemon.species.machima.desc1: Machima is said to wander the badlands, shrouded in a perpetual sandstorm. In legend, it whisks intruders away from the desert on a cushion of wind.
cobblemon.species.yacuma.name: Yacuma
cobblemon.species.yacuma.desc1: Seeing Yacuma's lights floating in the deep is a bad omen for sailors. Ships that pollute the sea are unlikely to escape its wrath and return to shore.
cobblemon.species.quetzar.name: Quetzar
cobblemon.species.quetzar.desc1: Quetzar's wings inspired the ancient Urobians to name the constellations. Legends warn that if it leaves, the night sky will turn pitch black.
cobblemon.species.quetzarspace.name: Quetzar
cobblemon.species.quetzarspace.desc1: Quetzar's wings inspired the ancient Urobians to name the constellations. Legends warn that if it leaves, the night sky will turn pitch black.
cobblemon.species.xochi.name: Xochi
cobblemon.species.xotec.name: Xotec
cobblemon.species.lukpup.name: Lukpup
cobblemon.species.lukpup.desc1: A shy Pokémon that only appears in perfect weather conditions. It's seen so rarely that some people aren't convinced that they're real.
cobblemon.species.lukagon.name: Lukagon
cobblemon.species.lukagon.desc1: To see a Lukagon in the wild requires incredible luck. It is said that if a Lukagon rubs up against you that you will be cured of any disease you may have.
cobblemon.species.kokiseed.name: Kokiseed
cobblemon.species.kokiseed.desc1: A small seed-like Pokémon that enjoys dancing at festivals. It scatters its leaves around for pizaz. It will sometimes try to imitate stronger Pokémon fighting.
cobblemon.species.kokipound.name: Kokipound
cobblemon.species.kokipound.desc1: Their passion for dance transitions to martial arts. Can be found sparring on beaches. It hits palm tree trunks with its bare fists.
cobblemon.species.kokismash.name: Kokismash
cobblemon.species.kokismash.desc1: These Pokémon are gentle in nature, despite their intimidating demeanor. They enjoy dancing, sparring, and lifting heavy things. They like to protect smaller friends.
cobblemon.species.chargo.name: Chargo
cobblemon.species.chargo.desc1: A mountain Pokémon that is kept around villages to keep people warm. They are ditzy and must be watched around flammable things.
cobblemon.species.burnaram.name: Burnaram
cobblemon.species.burnaram.desc1: The Pokémon puts on some bulk after evolving as it learns better to control its body. They can stand still for hours, meditating.
cobblemon.species.psysteed.name: Psysteed
cobblemon.species.psysteed.desc1: This Pokémon helps nomadic tribes haul building material using its telekenetic powers. Humans also dye the fur with archaic symbols.
cobblemon.species.darpole.name: Darpole
cobblemon.species.darpole.desc1: This Pokémon likes to play pranks on trainers who get too close to the edge of a pond, and then dive down into the water where it can't be reached.
cobblemon.species.brutoad.name: Brutoad
cobblemon.species.brutoad.desc1: Brutoad are known to be aggressive and territorial, following orders from a stronger lead Pokémon. Their fins are sharp on the edges.
cobblemon.species.godfrogger.name: Godfrogger
cobblemon.species.godfrogger.desc1: A lethargic Pokémon that prefers to give orders to its underlings instead of doing things itself. It tries to control wild areas, usually humid and swampy locations.
cobblemon.species.gorochu.name: Gorochu
cobblemon.species.gorochu.desc1: Gorochu are competitive by nature. They use their large tails, charged with electricity, to slash at their foes. They inhabit generally hot areas.
cobblemon.species.nidorook.name: Nidorook
cobblemon.species.nidorook.desc1: When a Nidorino or Nidorina evolve into Nidorook, they maintain their quadruped form. This evolutionary branch has an emphasis on speed.
cobblemon.species.quezsparce.name: Quezsparce
cobblemon.species.quezsparce.desc1: It uses its jaded chin as a plow to move dirt while tunneling. The growth in its wings allows it to be a faster, and more dangerous opponent above ground.
cobblemon.species.faeralynx.name: Faeralynx
cobblemon.species.faeralynx.desc1: The fur of a Faeralynx is highly sought after by the wealthy elite. They tend to spend at least 6 hours a day grooming themselves.
cobblemon.species.skulkraken.name: Skulkraken
cobblemon.species.skulkraken.desc1: A metal shell encasing a vicious sea creature. Its claws can rip through the steel hull of a ship. Legend has it that a giant Skulkraken exists in the vast oceans.
cobblemon.species.oozma.name: Oozma
cobblemon.species.oozma.desc1: When Muk become too hot, their bodies transition into molten lava. Oozma feed off pools of lava to continue to maintain their high body temperature.
cobblemon.species.omeon.name: Omeon
cobblemon.species.omeon.desc1: Omeon have a natural connection with the spirits. The flame on the end of its tail will flicker and blow in the direction of any unseen presence.
cobblemon.species.champeon.name: Champeon
cobblemon.species.champeon.desc1: Champeon are naturally competitive and will seek out bigger opponents. Can often be found in alley ways, scrapping with the fiercest scavengers.
cobblemon.species.lepideon.name: Lepideon
cobblemon.species.lepideon.desc1: Lepideon are natural pollen magnets. If a loved one of Lepideon has allergies to pollen, Lepideon will collect all the pollen in the area to help relieve the irritation.
cobblemon.species.guardeon.name: Guardeon
cobblemon.species.guardeon.desc1: If Eevees in a pack evolve, the combination of Guardeon and Champeon can be volatile. Guardeon have an eternal rivalry with any Champeon they meet, even if related.
cobblemon.species.obsideon.name: Obsideon
cobblemon.species.obsideon.desc1: Among mountainous Pokémon, it is relatively faster. It rams its obsidian covered spine against Graveler and Onix as a way of playing around to get them to chase it.
cobblemon.species.scorpeon.name: Scorpeon
cobblemon.species.scorpeon.desc1: It has been said that Scorpeon's tail has a mind of its own. Scorpeon will get its prey to focus on its face while it steadily aims its stinger for the next strike.
cobblemon.species.sphynxeon.name: Sphynxeon
cobblemon.species.sphynxeon.desc1: In ancient times, Sphynxeon were treated as a divine beings sent from the heavens. Many of the designs from the royal wardrobes were inspired by Sphynxeon.
cobblemon.species.nimbeon.name: Nimbeon
cobblemon.species.nimbeon.desc1: Nimbeon floats through the air, barely grazing the surface as it's used as a pushing-off point. If winds get too strong, it can blow Nimbeon away.
cobblemon.species.draconeon.name: Draconeon
cobblemon.species.draconeon.desc1: Draconeon are considered exotic and are rarely seen outside of Blackthorn City in Johto. Though smaller than most dragons, Draconeon are fierce and passionate.
cobblemon.species.eeveeon.name: Eeveeon
cobblemon.species.eeveeon.desc1: Eeveeon is the result of an Eevee with stable DNA. When exposed to the pure energy of an Astral Stone, Eevee is able to maintain its Normal typing during evolution.
cobblemon.species.vareon.name: Vareon
cobblemon.species.vareon.desc1: Vareon is the result of an Eevee trying to adapt to overly mutated DNA. This Pokémon seems to be able to change its typing fluidly throughout battle.
cobblemon.species.terathwack.name: Terathwack
cobblemon.species.terathwack.desc1: A rarely seen evolution to Marowak. The skull once worn as a Cubone has now become a natural part of the Pokémon. Can often be seen protecting wild Kangaskhan.
cobblemon.species.grimfowl.name: Grimfowl
cobblemon.species.grimfowl.desc1: In ancient times, people believed Grimfowl to be the harbinger of death, sent from the underworld. Nowadays its feathers are used as funeral décor.
cobblemon.species.sunflorid.name: Sunflorid
cobblemon.species.sunflorid.desc1: Sunflorid converts solar energy into nutrition and stores the excess for future use in battle. It has a tendency to singe its own hands while using Fire based attacks.
cobblemon.species.sorcerice.name: Sorcerice
cobblemon.species.sorcerice.desc1: This Pokémon's elemental abilities are so powerful that it must live in isolation while maintaining constant focus to prevent itself from freezing everything around it.
cobblemon.species.kecleodon.name: Kecleodon
cobblemon.species.kecleodon.desc1: Kecleodon are so good at blending in with their environments, that it was only just discovered recently that Kecleon could even evolve at all.
cobblemon.species.wereyena.name: Wereyena
cobblemon.species.wereyena.desc1: In rare occasion, when Mightyena are exposed to pure moonlight, they will evolve into Wereyena. Legends said that these Pokémon were just transformed humans.
cobblemon.species.reaptide.name: Reaptide
cobblemon.species.reaptide.desc1: Reaptide lurks in murky waters, searching for prey. It drags its victims deep into the water where they succumb to the high pressure, or suffocate.
cobblemon.species.kidfoot.name: Kidfoot
cobblemon.species.kidfoot.desc1: Most people consider Kidfoot to be a myth, being rarely seen by the average person. Because they are so elusive, little research has been done on them.
cobblemon.species.snosquatch.name: Snosquatch
cobblemon.species.snosquatch.desc1: Snosquatch can be highly aggressive and prone to fits of rage, which can become so intense that they cause avalanches. It will claim mountain tops as its territory.
cobblemon.species.grasquatch.name: Grasquatch
cobblemon.species.grasquatch.desc1: Grasquatch's existence was a subject of debate for many years due to its rarity. It is seen as a peaceful guardian of any forest that it inhabits.
cobblemon.species.arctusk.name: Arctusk
cobblemon.species.arctusk.desc1: It is believed that Arctusk may share a common ancestor with Phanpy, due to their similar biology. Arctusk roamed frigid environments hundreds of years ago.
cobblemon.species.gigantusk.name: Gigantusk
cobblemon.species.gigantusk.desc1: This Pokémon was revived from a specimen found frozen in an ancient glacier. It was hunted by ancient humans for its extremely durable armor.
cobblemon.species.iceros.name: Iceros
cobblemon.species.iceros.desc1: At birth, Iceros lacks the strength to lift its horn off the ground. It relies on the care of its herd to survive until it becomes strong enough to move on its own.
cobblemon.species.glacieros.name: Glacieros
